# gradientType

**Instance Property**

The gradient of the button’s border.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var gradientType: NSButton.GradientType { get set }
```

## Discussion

The value of this property is a constant that specifies the gradient used for the button’s border. See [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSButton/GradientType] for a list of possible values.

If the button has no border, setting this property has no effect on the button’s appearance. A concave gradient is darkest in the top-left corner; a convex gradient is darkest in the bottom-right corner. Weak versus strong is how much contrast exists between the colors used in opposite corners.



## Managing Graphics Attributes

- **backgroundColor**: The background color of the button.
- **bezelStyle**: The appearance of the button’s border, if it has one.
- **imageDimsWhenDisabled**: A Boolean value that indicates if the button’s image and text appear “dim” when the button is disabled.
- **isOpaque**: A Boolean value that indicates if the button is opaque.
- **isTransparent**: A Boolean value that indicates if the button is transparent.
- **showsBorderOnlyWhileMouseInside**: A Boolean value that indicates if the button displays its border only when the pointer is over it.
